result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanya M Kluck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Tanya M Kluck
parties.address: 21425 A Spring St, Robert E Ellsworth Correction Center, Union Grove, WI 53182

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Eligible for Substance Abuse and Challenge Incarceration Programs AFTER 2 years.

miscConds.notes: Work fulltime, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Get all prescriptions from 1 pharmacy. 
Sign necessary releases to monitor controlled substances she is on. 
Submit a DNA sample if not already done so.

Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 140 days in jail and 40 days on GPS Home Monitoring. 
Huber for employment, education, school and any counseling she may be involved in.

Defendant Tanya M. Kluck in court and in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA)  appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Review of file as to Drug Treatment Court. The Team vote to be terminated from Drug Court is addressed today. Court informs the Defendent of her rights to a Termination hearing with attorney and witnesses. Hearing would address the violations. 
Court questions the Defendant. 
Defendant doesn't want a Termination Hearing or an attorney.
Court finds the Defendant's descision has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. 
Defendant is removed from Drug Treatment Court.
Treatment Court Hearing on September 17, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tanya M. Kluck in court. 
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant makes a statement on her choice to be in Adult Treatment Court.
Court is heard.
Court questions employment, work hours and anticipated test results.
Court encourages defendant on clean testing for sober living.  Living situation is discussed.
Further encouragement by the Court.
Mr. Molepske questions the defendant.  She responds.  Molepske makes a statement and encourages her to meet daily goals.
Further statements from the Court.

Defendant Tanya M. Kluck in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Defendant Tanya M. Kluck in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:39 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court and both counsel have not received the record review. 
Court questions the clerk. 
Both parties are prepared to proceed with the record review.  Court asks that Atty Knaapen provide a full criminal history if possible. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Arendt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
4 years 6 months prison with 3 years initial confinement followed by 1 year 6 months extended supervision.  STAYED
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs AFTER 2 years. 
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months: 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.
Get all prescriptions from 1 pharmacy. 
Sign necessary releases to monitor controlled substances she is on. 
Work fulltime, go to school fulltime or combination thereof. 
Submit a DNA sample if not already done so. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Serve 180 days in jail. 
126 days credit. 
140 days to be in jail and 40 days can be on GPS Home Monitoring. 
Huber for employment, education, school and any counseling she may be involved in.

Defendant Tanya M. Kluck in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Defendant Tanya M. Kluck in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:58 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Arendt agrees to prior conviction. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Court orders a Record Review. 
Record review to be completed by 1/8/16 with copies forwarded to counsel. 
Bond and conditions of bond are continued. 

Atty Knaapen requests that bond be revoked at this time. 
Atty Arendt makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond is now revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
